newbot.botname_description: Bot name inside the Constructor. It is not visible to users and can be changed later.

howto.p4: Give the bot a name and @username

group_chat_select.chat_must_be_a_supergroup: The chat is not set up to be used with bot

dashboard.confirm_delete_bot: Are you sure you want to delete the bot? This can't be undone!
dashboard.confirm_stop_bot: Are you sure you want to stop the bot? It will stop responding to users! You can start it back from the constructor or the version history page.

form_results_page.csv_format: CSV files can be imported into Excel, Google Sheets, Airtable and other spreadsheets

blocks.cmd_1: The main entry point to the bot's logic. It is triggered whenever the user sends a command.
blocks.cmd_2: The /start command is defined for any bot. Other commands are optional, but you can configure them for key actions in your bot, such as: get help (/help), apply to volunteer (/apply), make a donation (/donate) and others.
blocks.feedback: Direct communication with bot operators who remain anonymous. It is possible to maintain anonymity for users as well.
blocks.form: Similar to Google Forms or Airtable, but inside your bot. Set up a list of questions (with a free answer or with a choice of options), and the bot will ask them to the user in the required order. Responses can be sent to a dedicated chat and/or saved in the bot’s memory to be accessed from the dashboard.
blocks.info: General information about the bot, including name and description.
blocks.langselect: Selecting the bot language. You define a list of available languages ​​- all texts in the bot must be localized in them.
blocks.menu: Nested branching by choosing from given options.

example_bot.and_provides_feedback: and handles the direct communication with bot's operator. Here you set up an admin chat and specify bot's response when the message is forwarded
example_bot.answer_is_sent_from_admin_chat: The response is sent manually from admin chat; the user receives it as a regular message
example_bot.bot_response: Hello! Thanks for getting in touch with us, how can we help?
example_bot.contains_answer_to_1: is connected to "Get the address" branch and contains the answer
example_bot.contains_answer_to_2: is connected to "Ask a question" branch and contains an alternate response
example_bot.feedback_handler_descr: The bot forwards the question to your admin chat, where operators can see it.  They process the message and respond, the message is sent back to the user.  If necessary, they can continue chatting via the bot.
example_bot.is_user_gets_response: The user receives a response to their question
example_bot.is_user_presses_1: Upon selecting "Get the address", the user receives the info
example_bot.is_user_presses_2: Upon selecting "Ask a question", the user is prompted to do so
example_bot.is_user_sends_msg: The user sends a messages and is assured the operators got it
example_bot.p1: Imagine that the bot provides your address and serves as a helpdesk to ask you questions. Here's what it might look like in action:
example_bot.thanks_well_get_back_to_you: Thanks, we'll get back to you!
example_bot.user_gets_welcome_msg: The user gets a welcome message with two buttons to choose from:
example_bot.user_presses_start: User activates the bot and presses "Start"
example_bot.user_starts: User starts chatting with the bot

glossary.h3: How do bots work in Telegram?
glossary.p1: A Telegram bot is a program that runs inside the messenger and interacts with users.  Simply put, this is an automated interlocutor configured to perform certain actions. Bots use the Telegram API to send and receive messages, manage channels or groups, and perform other functions on the platform. Users communicate with the bot as with a regular contact, and the bot responds depending on its settings and logic.
glossary.p2: API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of rules and tools that allow programs to interact with each other. Think of the API as a menu in a restaurant: you select a dish (function or data) and the kitchen (another program) prepares it and serves it to you. You don't see the cooking process, but you know exactly what you will get in the end. An API works the same way, giving one program the ability to use the functions of another program without having to delve into its internal processes.
glossary.p3: To communicate on Telegram, the user creates an account with a phone number and accesses it through a password and two-factor authentication. Telegram bots also have an account, but it is created through BotFather, and access is provided through a token. A token is a unique key that confirms the right to use the API and is transmitted with each request to the server. Like a personal password, the token must be protected.
glossary.p4_l2: Do not have access to message history
glossary.p4_l3: Don't have access to a user's phone number, unless explicitly requested
glossary.p4_l5: By default have limited access to messages in group chats
glossary.p4_l6: Can't handle files larger than 20 MB

readme.p1: Telebot Constructor allows you to create complex and multilingual dialogues with various conditions and solutions in the language of flowcharts. In this studio, you assemble the logic of the bot from blocks, like a constructor, customizing its behavior to suit your needs.
readme.title: About

studio.confirm_exit_unsaved_changes: Exit studio? Unsaved changes will be lost.
studio.draft_version_found: Unsaved version found. Restore and continue editing it?

command.description_hint_1: Visible in the menu next to input field or as autocomplete when typing
command.description_hint_2: In multilingual bots, this description is not localized - we recommend writing in the most popular language or several options in one line. For example: /help – “help” or “help/помощь/assistere”.

form.chat_howto: How to set up a chat?
form.chat_howto_p1_1: Open Telegram and add your bot
form.chat_howto_p1_2: to a new or existing group chat
form.chat_howto_p2: The chat will be available to select in the menu
form.chat_howto_p3: If it's not, return to Telegram and make sure you've added the bot to the correct group chat; inside the chat, send the following command:
form.only_tg_name_descr: Responses will record the user's current Telegram name
form.responses_save_to_store: Save to be accessible from the Dashboard
form.save_anonymous_descr: Responses will record an anonymized emoji identifier (e.g., "🚒🧸🕐🧔🏙🏣"). It distinguishes between users but does not reveal their identity.
form.tg_name_and_account_descr: Responses will record full Telegram account data: name, @username, id
